topic.title: status
topic.shortdesc: Check the status of the cluster configuration service and member processes, including locators, and servers.

topic.title: status cluster-config-service
topic.shortdesc: Displays the status of the cluster configuration service.

body.p: Displays the status of cluster configuration service on all the locators where enable-cluster-configuration is set to true.
Availability: Online. You must be connected in gfsh to a JMX Manager member to use this command.

p.codeblock:
gfsh>status cluster-config-service Status of shared configuration on locators
Name | Status -------- | ------- locator8 | RUNNING

topic.title: status locator
topic.shortdesc: Displays the status of the specified locator.

body.p:
The status will be one of the following:
started
online
offline
not responding
Availability: Online or offline. If you want to obtain the status of a locator while you are offline, use the --dir or the --pid parameter.

row.entry: Name/ID of the locator for which to display status. You must be connected to the JMX Manager to use this option. Can be used to obtain status of remote locators. See .
Hostname or IP address on which the Locator is running.
Port on which the locator is listening.
Process ID (PID) of the running locator.
Directory in which the locator was started.

p.codeblock:
gfsh>status locator --name=locator1 Locator in /home/stymon/gemfire/locator1 on ubuntu.local[10334] as locator1 is currently online. Process ID: 2401 Uptime: 12 minutes 3 seconds GemFire Version: 8.0.0 Java Version: 1.7.0_65 Log File: /home/stymon/gemfire/locator1/locator1.log JVM Arguments: -Dgemfire.enable-cluster-configuration=true -Dgemfire.load-cluster-configuration-from-dir=false -Dgemfire.launcher.registerSignalHandlers=true -Djava.awt.headless=true -Dsun.rmi.dgc.server.gcInterval=9223372036854775806 Class-Path: /home/stymon/Pivotal_GemFire_800_b48319_Linux/lib/locator-dependencies.jar:/usr/local/java/lib/tools.jar
Cluster configuration service is up and running.

topic.title: status server
topic.shortdesc: Display the status of the specified cache server.

body.p: Availability: Online or offline. If you want to obtain the status of a server while you are offline, use the --dir or the --pid parameter.

row.entry: Name or ID of the Cache Server for which to display status. You must be connected to the JMX Manager to use this option. Can be used to obtain status of remote servers. See .
Process ID (PID) of the running Cache Server.
Directory in which the Cache Server was started.

p.codeblock: gfsh>status server --name=server1 Server in /home/stymon/gemfire/server1 on ubuntu.local[40404] as server1 is currently online. Process ID: 2726 Uptime: 1 minute 3 seconds GemFire Version: 8.0.0 Java Version: 1.7.0_65 Log File: /home/stymon/gemfire/server1/server1.log JVM Arguments: -Dgemfire.default.locators=192.168.129.145[10334] -Dgemfire.use-cluster-configuration=true -XX:OnOutOfMemoryError="kill -9 %p" -Dgemfire.launcher.registerSignalHandlers=true -Djava.awt.headless=true -Dsun.rmi.dgc.server.gcInterval=9223372036854775806 Class-Path: /home/stymon/Pivotal_GemFire_800_b48319_Linux/lib/server-dependencies.jar:/usr/local/java/lib/tools.jar
